posts.name: scott-signal
posts.cooked:
Hi everyone! The Signal team is releasing a new version of Signal Desktop, v7.33.0-beta.1. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta here.

Release notes:

  • This update fixes a bug where the correct context menu wasn’t appearing after right-clicking on an emoji while selecting text. Thanks, @khuddite!

Commit changes: Comparing v7.32.0-beta.1…v7.33.0-beta.1 · signalapp/Signal-Desktop · GitHub

Thanks for being a beta tester!

Previous beta: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.32 release

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.32 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.33.0-beta.1

53 new commits since 7.32.0-beta.1:

Show commits

  • v7.33.0-alpha.1 [1]

  • Only set last group fetch for server updates [2]

  • Add backup attachment restore idle state [3]

  • Remove unnecesary profile fetch assertion [4]

  • Centralize logic for finding/fetching the ringing call [5]

  • Update captcha response error handling [6]

  • Add test for call link storage [7]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.48.4 [8]

  • Refresh group state if missing group members [9]

  • switch to v2/calling/relays endpoint [10]

  • Log query stats during backup import [11]

  • Fix pressing screenshare multiple times on Linux Wayland [12]

  • Allow link previews without image or title [13]

  • Fix link-and-sync in Alpha [14]

  • Use libsignal PassThroughs instead of our own [15]

  • Batch attachment download jobs [16]

  • Only show download button if message has attachments to download [17]

  • Upgrade better-sqlite3 to 9.0.8 [18]

  • handleBlocked: Continue on if we receive non-ACI [19]

  • Unlink on backup interruption [20]

  • Default test-electron worker count to 1 locally [21]

  • Improve chat search filtering [22]

  • Fix download media banner styles [23]

  • Import/export view-once messages [24]

  • Faster backup import for large conversation count [25]

  • Add experimental win32 arm64 build support [26]

  • Fix script build-win32-arm64 [27]

  • Allow link-and-sync transfer to be in any CDN [28]

  • Release notes for 7.32 [29]

  • Update strings [30]

  • Update DNS fallback [31]

  • Fix win32 arm translation check [32]

  • Fix binary name in CI [33]

  • Consider own join time for group call missing media key check [34]

  • Ensure that calls ring at more appropriate times [35]

  • Improve message migration error handling [36]

  • Fix ringing direct calls to wait for after prering state [37]

  • Update to ringrtc v2.48.6 [38]

  • Change attributes before queuing job [39]

  • Timeout provisioning socket when visibility=false [40]

  • Add experimental Linux support for ringrtc ADM. [41]

  • Fix adding large stickers in media editor [42]

  • Show backup import UI on Link-and-Sync [43]

  • Don't run storage service concurrently with backup [44]

  • Brand Refresh [45]

  • Fix dark mode when in light mode os theme [46]

  • Use classes for QueryFragment in sql [47]

  • Retain strikethrough formatting in message bubble mentions [48]

  • Improve scroll behavior of left pane [49]

  • Fix context menu text being different based on where right click occurred for emojis [50]

  • Add release notes for 7.33 [51]

  • Update strings [52]

  • 7.33.0-beta.1 [53]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Desktop v7.32.0-beta.1…v7.33.0-beta.1

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

posts.name: scott-signal
posts.cooked:
@Lkunited There are a lot of mostly-inconsequental errors in your log that tell me something has gone wrong, like you restored from backup, or something like that. Can you think of anything that could have affected Desktop’s state on your machine?

The one consequential error is this - you’re getting failed messages from someone whose ACI ends in 888. You can find that in search with !serviceIdEndsWith:888 - and ideally be able to get logs from their primary device.

ERROR 2024-11-07T18:57:07.747Z queueEncryptedEnvelope error handling envelope [REDACTED]888.1 > [REDACTED]bc6 1730968465042 (573c4e32f60e45779ba45b5b7d29b547) : LibSignalError: missing sender key state for distribution ID [REDACTED]6ba

scott-signal:

Can you think of anything that could have affected Desktop’s state on your machine?

@scott-signal I just started my Laptop from power saving mode, maybe this affected Signal.
The error the App showed me was, however, the second part you described the following:

scott-signal:

The one consequential error is this - you’re getting failed messages from someone whose ACI ends in 888.

I will write you when I received the Logs.

posts.name: Philip Struthers
posts.cooked: I’m having an issue where i’m seeing incongruency in messages in my family chat. Message from october 13th-23rd are appearing AFTER the messages from today on only 2 of my 3 desktop clients and not on iphone. Additionally oddly only on one desktop version of signal beta, messages that all appear in order from October 7th-21st but whose days start with the statement that “Safety Number with ______ has changed” all have the actual date headings in the feed replaced with the Heading “Today”, but when requesting Info for messages in those “Today’s” each messages dates are correct.

posts.name: Philip Struthers
posts.cooked: Additionally very oddly, on a new signal desktop beta client that I installed on this machine on November 4th, after the messages that are actually from “Today”, the family messages from october 13th to 23rd are present, but now messages from october 15th- 26th but only from one specific user are now syncing after those 13th to 23rd messages. None of these messages should be present cause they’re from before the date of November 4th that I installed the client on the new machine.

posts.name: skmedix
posts.cooked:
Sticker button tooltip is still not translatable

Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.26 release Desktop Beta Feedback
I can’t test 7.26 right now, but 7.25 still has this problem. When installing a sticker pack from a modal, after clicking on a sticker, the snackbar (or tooltip?) appears with non-translated text. [image]

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.26 release

posts.cooked:
Not quite sure, if it’s beta related. Signal desktop is crashing on macos, when I turn on Mullvad VPN.

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.33.0-beta.1/23fa61b2db6f3d2e816ae44f29ad45b3f88ae9d6029f91ae0a47d6a1750de0fe.gz

posts.name: Trevor Biller
posts.cooked: Sorry you’re seeing that; can you share logs and message timestamps?

posts.name: Trevor Biller
posts.cooked: Hi, this is due to a known bug in macOS kernel which unfortunately has not yet been fixed. You could try starting Signal with --disable-ipv6 which may help with this issue.
